Dear Ms. Obrzut:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on May 13. 2024. The renewal inspection has determined substantial compliance with
applicable licensing statutes and rules. Your license is renewed, and you will be receiving
the license in the mail. It is valid only at your present address and is nontransferable. If
you move, please notify us at least 30 days in advance.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at 517-899-6024.
Sincerely,
Deborah Will, Licensing Consultant

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during this
period under review.
Financial Overview

N/A
Chief Administrator Assessment
There were no CAPs submitted for the period under review. No additional issues
were noted by the Chief Administrator.
Staff and Youth Interviews
All staff gave positive reviews of the facility.
The children were observed but could not be interviewed as they are non-verbal.
Description of Agency Walk Through
I observed the large play/activity room with specialized play/learning equipment
designed for children who are blind with multiple disabilities. Bedrooms were
nicely decorated with cartoon and animal themes. Bathrooms and kitchen were
clean.

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes. It is recommended that the agency be issued a renewal of their regular
license.
